text: - My name's Meg.
I am a software development manager.
I lead our S3 object encryption team
and have been at AWS for two years.
(upbeat music)

Before I came to AWS, I was
in software development.
I was a manager before I came here.
What makes me love the encryption space

is I was actually an applied
math major in undergrad,
and and that's where encryption lives.

So I get to go a little
bit back to my love of math
and combine that with my job experience

in software development to
lead this encryption space.
In my first year here
as the lead of the object encryption team,
we delivered a feature called Bucket Keys.
And this feature helps our customers
save 99% of their encryption cost.

And so it was a huge
win for our customers,

and awesome to deliver that
just within my first year.
(gentle music)

What brought me to Amazon
was the developer focus.

I liked how much ownership
the development teams here
have to help define the features
that we launch for our customers.

I mean, AWS has been by far
my favorite job in my career.
(upbeat music)
